title: Sami Panico
text:
Sami Panico (born 4 June 1993) is an Italian <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player of <a href="Ethiopia">Ethiopia</a>n descent who plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions">Prop</a>, he currently plays for <a href="Rugby%20Calvisano">Calvisano</a>. Panico made his debut for the <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italian national team</a> in June 2016 and was part of the squad for the <a href="2017%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2017 Six Nations Championship</a>.
In 2014 and 2016, Panico was a "permit player" for <a href="Zebre">Zebre</a>, but he didn't play in official matches.
On 1 October 2018, it was announced that Panico had been arrested after 1.5 kilos of <a href="marijuana">marijuana</a>, 330 grammes of <a href="hashish">hashish</a> and €10,000 in cash were discovered in the garden of his home in <a href="Rome%2C%20Italy">Rome, Italy</a>. His rugby club, Zebre, suspended him on 8 September 2018 while the investigation was taking place. On 5 October 2018, Zebre announced that they had cancelled Panico's contract with the club.
